title: Tabernacle Construction
shortSummary: Exodus 26 provides detailed instructions for constructing the tabernacle, the portable sanctuary for Israel's worship during the wilderness journey. The chapter emphasizes precise craftsmanship and the use of specific materials, symbolizing God's holiness and the sacred space where He would dwell among His people.
timeline: c. 1446 BC - The Exodus and Wilderness Journey

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: God's appointed leader who receives and conveys the instructions for building the tabernacle.

keyCharacters.name: Bezalel
keyCharacters.description: The chief craftsman endowed by God with skill and wisdom to oversee the construction of the tabernacle.

definitions.definition: Heavenly angelic beings often depicted as guardians of God's holiness, embroidered on the tabernacle curtains to signify divine presence.
Metal clasps or hooks used to join the curtains of the tabernacle securely together.
A durable and fine acacia wood used for the structural boards and bars of the tabernacle.
The finished edge of a piece of fabric that prevents it from unraveling, important for joining the curtains.

outline.heading: Curtains of Fine Linen and Cherubims
outline.description: Instructions for making ten curtains of fine twined linen embroidered with cherubims, joined by golden clasps to form the inner covering of the tabernacle, symbolizing purity and divine protection.

outline.heading: Goats' Hair Covering
outline.description: Directions for eleven curtains of goats' hair to cover the tabernacle, providing a durable outer layer and illustrating the layered protection of God's dwelling place.

outline.heading: Additional Coverings and Structural Boards
outline.description: Specifications for coverings of rams' skins dyed red and badgers' skins, and the construction of wooden boards with silver sockets to support the tabernacle, highlighting the combination of beauty and strength.

outline.heading: Bars, Gold Overlay, and Assembly
outline.description: Instructions for wooden bars overlaid with gold to secure the boards, emphasizing the preciousness of the sanctuary and the importance of following God's design exactly.

outline.heading: The Vail and Entrance Hanging
outline.description: Details about the vail separating the holy place from the most holy, and the embroidered hanging for the tabernacle door, symbolizing the separation between God and man and the access granted through God's provision.

application: Obediently follow God's detailed instructions in all areas of life, trusting His wisdom even when the reasons are not fully understood.
Recognize the holiness of God and approach Him with reverence, understanding that He is separate and distinct from sin.
Value the craftsmanship and dedication in serving God, offering our best talents and resources for His glory.
Appreciate the provision of access to God through Christ, symbolized by the vail that separates the holy place from the most holy.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt make fifty taches of gold, and couple the curtains together with the taches: and it shall be one tabernacle.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the unity and sacredness of the tabernacle, symbolizing the unified dwelling place of God among His people.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt rear up the tabernacle according to the fashion thereof which was shewed thee in the mount.
keyVerses.significance: Emphasizes the importance of exact obedience to God's revealed pattern, underscoring divine authority and order.

keyVerses.text: And thou shalt hang up the vail under the taches, that thou mayest bring in thither within the vail the ark of the testimony: and the vail shall divide unto you between the holy place and the most holy.
keyVerses.significance: This verse introduces the vail, symbolizing the separation between God’s holiness and humanity, pointing forward to Christ’s work in granting access to God.
